name: useFetch
description: Custom hook that provides a wrapper around the native [`fetch API`](https://developer.mozilla.org/en-US/docs/Web/API/Fetch_API) to handle HTTP requests with state management, abort capability, and TypeScript support.

props.name: options
props.description: Options for customizing the request and hook behavior (optional).

schema.name: immediate
schema.description: If `true`, the fetch request will be executed immediately upon mounting or when the URL changes.

schema.name: onError
schema.description: Callback function invoked when the request fails.

schema.name: onSuccess
schema.description: Callback function invoked when the request completes successfully.

returns.name: abort
returns.description: Aborts the current request if it is pending.

returns.name: data
returns.description: The data received from the response, or null if not yet received.

returns.name: error
returns.description: The error object if the request failed, or null if successful.

returns.name: loading
returns.description: Indicates if the request is currently in progress.

returns.name: reset
returns.description: Resets the state to its initial values (data: null, loading: false, error: null).

types.name: UseFetchState
types.description: The state representation of the fetch request.

properties.name: data
properties.description: The data received from the response, or null if not yet received.

properties.name: error
properties.description: The error object if the request failed, or null if successful.

properties.name: loading
properties.description: Indicates if the request is currently in progress.
